sense.name: lose or emit blood
sense.examples: He bled so much he needed a transfusion. Head wounds bleed a lot. He's such a Notre Dame fan, he bleeds blue and gold.

sense.name: suffer as if by losing blood
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 BLEED for PP
sense.examples: My heart bleeds for you. I bleed for the animals victimized by cruelty. Viewers will bleed for the plight of the heroine.

sense.name: draw blood as a medical procedure
sense.examples: He bled her plentifully and gave her a dose of the mercurial medicine.

sense.name: drain of a resource, usually money
sense.examples: The patent officer signed, and bled me of some more money. Enough already. You've bled me dry. It has bled me of all my certainty and trust. The winter's trials had bled her of strength.

sense.name: drain of a substance
sense.examples: The mechanic bled the brake line. If you've bled the radiators and the water is black, then you have a slight problem. This is an older type of dimmer, where excess power is bled off into heat.

sense.name: seep or diffuse
sense.examples: The colors are guaranteed not to bleed. Liberal bias in colleges bleeds into the classroom. Prairie bleeds into farmland bleeds into forest.
